description: A "male version" spin-off of TV anime "One Room".

tags.name: Male Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several male characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: POV
tags.description: Point of View; features scenes shown from the perspective of the series protagonist.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Cohabitation
tags.description: Features two or more people who live in the same household and develop a romantic or sexual relationship.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/115874632) | [Website](leftside.info/index.html)

Hidari is a Japanese illustrator and character designer. He is primarily known as an illustrator for video games and light novels. Some of his notable designs for anime include [Fractale](https://anilist.co/anime/9314/) and [Natsuiro Kiseki](https://anilist.co/anime/12119/) and for PS3 game Atelier Ayesha, and best known light novel illustrations are for [Sasami-san@Ganbaranai](https://anilist.co/manga/69349/).

His pseudonym and circle "Left Side" comes from the fact that he predominantly uses his left hand.

He was awarded third place in the 2010 “Kono Light Novel ga Sugoi!” illustrator ranking.

__Notable works outside anime:__

- Atelier Ayesha: The Alchemist of Dusk (Video Game, 2012) (Character Illustration / Character Designing, Illustration)
- Atelier Escha & Logy: Alchemists of the Dusk Sky (Video Game, 2014) (Character Illustration / Designing)
- Atelier Shallie: Alchemists of the Dusk Sea (Video Game, 2014) (Character Illustration / Character Designing)
- Fire Emblem Echoes: Shadows of Valentia (Video Game, 2017) (Character Design & Illustration)
- Record of Lodoss War: Deedlit in Wonder Labyrinth (Video Game, 2020) (Character Drafts)
Suzuki Ryouhei is a production manager.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sakzo2010)

Takashi Sakurai is an animation producer and editor. Takashi Sakurai made his debut in the anime industry in 2003, at Tokyo Kids. He originally was one of the supporting editors at Tokyo Kids, and was later promoted as the general animation editor at the studio. Prior to working for the anime industry, he worked in the live-action industry, and did some CG work at production company Future Pirates. After working on Magikano, he left Tokyo Kids, and joined Anime International Company (AIC), as one of their in-house editors. Due to Sakurai joining the studio, AIC also began offering its editing services to other studios, such as TNK, for School Days. In 2010, he made his animation producer debut with Shukufuku no Campanella, due to it streamlining the production process at AIC. In 2014 he left AIC, and founded his own production company Typhoon Graphics Co., Ltd, otherwise known as Typhoon Graphics, in which its main services are: color design, color design inspection, finish animation, special effects, 2D design, photography, and editing work. 

He also has a good relationship with anime director Seiji Kishi, and after the success of 2006's co-production by GONZO and AIC's  "Seto no Hanayome", Kishi often started directing anime produced at AIC, such as: "Astro Fighter Sunred", "Persona 4: The Animation", and "Jinrui wa Suitai Shimashita".

__Hobbies:__ cooking, music, singing

[Website](http://www.artsvision.co.jp/talent/779/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/toriumi_kohsuke)

**[Profile](https://www.artsvision.co.jp/talent/526/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tomoaki_Maeno) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%89%8D%E9%87%8E%E6%99%BA%E6%98%AD) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Tomoaki___Maeno)**

Married fellow voice actor [Mikako Komatsu](https://anilist.co/staff/105071/Mikako-Komatsu) on May 12, 2020.

**Non anime roles:**
- [Zhongli](https://anilist.co/character/209686/) - Genshin Impact (Video Game)
- Luke Sullivan - Street Fighter (Video Game)
- Lif - Fire Emblem Heroes (Video Game)

__Height:__ 173 cm
__Hobbies:__ Karaoke, gaming
__Agency:__ Across Entertainment

[Profile](http://across-ent.com/talent/men/natsuki_hanae.html) | [Website](https://columbia.jp/hanaenatsuki/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hanae0626) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3C3YOGFjn7Pq3lOCeUFHfg) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/hanae0626/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hanae_natsuki0626/)

Won Best Rookie at the 9th Seiyuu Awards (2015) for his role as Inaho Kaizuka in _Aldnoah.Zero_. Won Best Lead Actor at the 14th Seiyuu Awards (2020) for his role as Tanjiro Kamado in _Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba_.

He is married, is a father of twin daughters, and has a cat named [Konpei](https://anilist.co/staff/269430/Konpei).

__Non-Anime Roles:__

- Protagonist - Metaphor: ReFantazio (VG)
- Ling Yang - Wuthering Waves (VG)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/takuyaohata)

__Takuya Oohata__  is a composer and arranger from Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan. He is affiliated with F.M.F.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/takuyaohata)

__Takuya Oohata__  is a composer and arranger from Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan. He is affiliated with F.M.F.

[Profile (F.M.F)](http://www.fmf-music.com/members/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/eba_cadode) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/eba_1987_/)

Eba is a Japanese music producer, guitarist, composer, arranger and member of pop unit [cadode](https://twitter.com/cadode_). He is also affiliated with F.M.F Corporation.

_Note: Not to be confused with the vocalist and lyricist with the same name [Hirokazu Ebata aka Eba](https://anilist.co/staff/161178)_
